intro: Manilkara sansibarensis, commonly known as the East African sapodilla, is a tropical tree native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, glossy leaves. The tree produces oval, yellowish fruits that are edible and have a sweet, creamy pulp similar to that of the common sapodilla. Its latex, which is milky and sticky, is used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
